name: Tiny Home in the Heart of the City- ECO FRIENDLY
description:
160 sq ft + 80 sq ft loft for sleeping, Sleeps 2 in the loft, linens included, no pets please (property is shared with 2 senior dogs), private parking, private entrance.

The Tiny Home is limited 2 PAID guests. No other guests unless the owner approves in advance.

The space
Here's the fun details of this Tiny Home experience in the middle of the city:

160 sq ft + 80 sq ft in the loft for sleeping, Sleeps 2 in the loft, linens included, no pets please (property is shared with 2 senior dogs), private parking, private entrance.
Outside entertainment area with BBQ grill. Enjoy those wonderful Colorado evenings with colleagues or friends!

The Tiny Home is limited 2 PAID guests. No other guests unless the owner approves in advance.

Private entrance to large open space park with access to bike and running paths that link the entire city.

8 minutes to Downtown Denver.

description:
Enjoy the famous Colorado weather and unplug in indoor & outdoor living.
Our charming guesthouse has a serene ambiance throughout every area.
Spread out on the large sofa while relaxing, reading, or playing a game.
Spend a sunny afternoon out on the hammock or enjoying the garden parlor sofa, sink into the shared hot tub, practice yoga on the Pauda deck.
We are located next to downtown and in the neighborhood of lower highlands,
Short walks to Superb coffee shops, restaurants & microbrews, distilleries, dispensary & downtown. We are 420 (outdoors only), LBGTQ friendly, fragrance & pet-free.

description:
This room is in the basement. It does not have its own entrance, but is fairly private. Please read the full room description (esp. hearing footsteps above.) I want my guests to be happy and have no surprises. Also, please have some info in your Airbnb profile.

The space

Many empty drawers and a good amount of closet space available. You may make yourself at home in kitchen and other public areas of the house. Wireless internet. name: Baker Studio Close to EVERYTHING
description:
Great place for a few nights or months! Significant discounts for week or month+. Ideal for traveling nurses, med students, or transitioning to Denver. Close to Denver Health Medical Center, downtown, professional sports venues and performing arts. Cute 1890's neighborhood walkable to breweries, coffee shops, restaurants, shops and Mayan Theater on Broadway, and Santa Fe Arts District. Easy access with major freeways/roads and RTD. No pets in studio but my two dogs may be in the backyard.

The space
This newly built, highly functional studio is equipped with full kitchen, including stove/oven, dishwasher, microwave, and refrigerator; and fully stocked with cooking and eating equipment. Significant cabinet and closet space. Flooded with natural light. It has everything you need for a comfortable stay for a few nights or a few months! For your convenience coffee, tea and paper products supplied to get you started but are not replenished throughout the stay.

name: Highland Snug
description:
The Highland Snug is the lower level of a condo at the center of Lower Highland (LoHi). It provides an excellent live/work environment, steps from one of the most exciting neighborhood in Denver. There are more than 50 restaurants within five blocks of the Snug. The Snug has a walk score of 90.

Located on Upper 15th Street, the Snug is a short walk or ride to Union Station, the 16th Street Mall bus, light rail, Coors Field, Pepsi Center, Mile High Stadium, and downtown Denver.

The space
The lower level (about 1000 sq. ft.) is a lock-off unit with an open living room, master bedroom, full bathroom and kitchen. The living room has a sunroof ceiling that keeps it bright and comfortable. A Murphy bed in the kitchen provides a second sleeping area that can be separated from the living room by a sliding wall. The master bedroom has a queen bed, a desk and private door into the bathroom.

name: Creative Haven in Artistâ€™s Abode
description:
This two-bedroom, two-bath house is filled with treasures, trinkets, art, and oddities from around the world. Features a spacious front yard, patio, cozy corners, large kitchen, and unique curios from near and far. Curious adventure seekers and art aficionados will delight at this special space!

The space
The house is located just 5-6 minutes from downtown Denver with a driveway in front and plenty of street parking. There is a bus stop down the block and a coffee shop within walking distance. This home is best for one or two couples, a few friends, single travelers or professionals, or a small family with an older child who can be trusted with small, fragile objects. Nice garden in front and small lawn adjacent to house. Neighborhood is filled with WW I era craftsman cottages. 2 Parks within walking distance (City and Congress).

It is also located close to both I70, I25, 20 minutes from the airport and 2 blocks from the light rail.

The house is beautifully restored to it authentic charm. One of Denver's oldest remaining homes, you can enjoy all of the original details of this architectural masterpiece. The master bath is modern with three shower heads, one of the bathrooms has a clawfoot bathtub and the other has a deep Japanese tub perfect for a long soak. The house does not have a TV or a microwave.

It's an easy walk to Roslindale Square, where you will find Commuter rail and buses to anywhere you want to go. Roslindale has one of the city's best farmers' markets, as well as excellent restaurants.

About our neighborhood: [Source: WikiTravel]
Bywater is a neighborhood a bit east (down river) from the French Quarter with a healthy mix of blue collar folks who grew up here, and more recent bohemian arrivals. Artists and musicians relocated here when the French Quarter became too pricey. description:

The space
RED ROOM

Frenchmen House is my home. I share it with my dog, Charles (a huge, cuddly, Golden), Molly (king of the feline world), and my airbnb guests.

The house retains the architectural details that make New Orleans homes interesting and beautiful -- 13 ft. ceilings, transom windows, original wood floors, and double parlor with functioning pocket doors. Very few renovations have altered this original home, and its charm represents the homes of its era. The architectural style of the house is referred to as a Sidehall, so unlike a traditional shotgun, one does not have to walk thru each room to get to the next.

Great backyard for entertaining -- very private courtyard setting. Smoking is allowed in the backyard.

description:

Perfect location to experience the joie de vivre of New Orleans. Historic Esplanade Avenue is lined with oaks tree and many original 19th century mansions, and it once functioned as a "millionaire's row" for the Louisiana Creole section of the city, similarly as uptown's St. Charles Avenue was to the Americans. Esplanade is also the dividing line between the French Quarter and the Faubourg Marigny, two of the best and most historic neighborhoods in the city!

The space
The apartment is on the ground floor (street entrance) of a townhouse built in 1830, complete with stained glass, exquisite woodwork, 15 ft ceilings, 6 gigantic windows and two fireplaces. It's a very large one bedroom with giant sliding pocket doors that can open the space up.

The apartment itself has a comfy queen sized bed and a fully furnished kitchen with everything you need. The bathroom has a claw foot tub, original to the house. name: Huckabuck Village in Historic Treme
description:
The space
Beautifully appointed private room with Queen Size bed, private bath with balcony and magical skyline view of downtown New Orleans in an historic Treme Townhouse. Equipped with Wifi.
Huckabuck Village was built in 1857 during the early developmental Hey Day of the neighborhood known as Faubourg Treme'. All of its original Italianate architectural features designed by the ship captain builder have been preserved. You will be able to take a step back in time and enjoy a relaxing, artistic and holistic environment in the house and courtyard replete with fountains and a pond.
Huckabuck Village is centrally located in Treme' between the French Quarter and the Fairgrounds/Jazz Fest making it ideal for easy access to many of New Orleans attractions, festivals and activities. There are 3 queen beds/1 queen sofa bed to sleep 8 guests & the master bed is a Tempurpedic. You can walk to the French Quarter, Bourbon St., Frenchmen St., the Streetcar, etc. There's free street parking. Custom guidebook at house. Well behaved pets welcome. Please read the full description and see the pictures. :)

The space
The house is what's called a "shotgun" which means that each bedroom walks into the next and there are no hallways and are only separated by doors so please keep that in mind when booking. The main reason to book this listing is to be within walking distance of all the things to do in the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Frenchmen Street, Marigny, Bywater, and Downtown. description:
A 750-sqft one-bedroom studio apartment with separate entrance conveniently located 3 blocks riverside of Magazine Street near Jackson Avenue. Historic shotgun double layout on the dividing edge of the Lower Garden District and the Irish Channel. The apartment has an eat-in kitchen, living room, basic TV, WiFi internet, shower/tub, dishwasher, w/d, coffee maker, porch, 12ft ceilings, central AC/heat and ample closet space.

The space
Perfect for lone traveler, a couple, or close friends. One queen bed in bedroom sleeps two comfortably. There is full size couch in the living room and there is a queen size air mattress and bedding that can be set up in the living room.

Guest access
Front porch and apartment.

Other things to note
For convention travelers wanting to get out of the downtown hotels and see a new part of the city, the New Orleans Morial Convention Center is a quick one-mile away.

description:
The space
Welcome New Orleans visitors! This little house is just blocks from the restaurants and attractions of the French Quarter, Frenchman Street Entertainment District, Bywater, Marigny, Treme and St Claude neighborhoods. It is walking distance or a short cab ride eight blocks from the French Quarter, 6 blocks from the Frenchman Street Entertainment District and a ten-minute drive to the Central Business District and the Mercedes-Benz Superdome. Its also just six blocks to the revitalized St. Claude Ave. corridor which includes cutting-edge art galleries, alternative theater venues such as the Allways Lounge and Theater, the New Orleans Healing Center, and the renovated St. Roch Market. The St. Claude bus line can connect you to the streetcar that can take you all the way Uptown to the Garden District, the University section and Carrollton neighborhoods or out to Mid-City, City Park with the New Orleans Art Museum, Storyland, the Botannical Garden, the Amusement Park

We welcome you into our home to stay in our guest room suite, up one flight of stairs from the front door. name: Treme Creole Cottage
description:
The space
If youâ€™re going to visit New Orleans, you should feel like you are in New Orleans. Built in the 1820s, this Creole cottage, with front and rear balconies, high ceilings, ceiling fans, hard pine floors and slate mantles, feels like the Crescent City.

But the house is also loaded with modern creature comforts like a whirlpool tub, a gourmet Miele stove and central air and heat. This three-bedroom house can sleep up to four people. In addition to the master bathroom, there is a separate full bath with a shower and a half bath downstairs. In front of the house is a small citrus grove which perfumes the air when the trees are in season. At other times of the year, the night blooming jasmine wafts through the air as the sun goes down. There is free wifi and two HD televisions and a stereo with speakers that play throughout the house.

name: The New Orleans Sweeeet Retreat
description:
The space
About My Place:
This breezy two bedroom is tucked into a historic neighborhood known as Old Arabi- overlooking the Historic and newly restored @ $8.5 million Jackson Barracks Military Museum (free to see btw). Other interesting spots to get a glimpse of the history of New Orleans are the LaBeau Haunted Manion (short walk over, if you dare ; ) ) and the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve and Battlefield.

Only 2 miles from the French Quarter, this laid back area is known for its rich history and awesome accessibility to all the city has to offer within arms reach!

The house has plenty of room for a large group or completely ideal for an intimate couple's weekend.

My place features 12' ceilings, hardwood floors, fans throughout, 42" flatscreen with cable and DVD player, wireless internet, an updated bathroom and fantastic antiques as well as finds picked up in in spots from Paris to Mexico to N. Africa.

name: Legal Rental : Elegant Lower Garden District Home
description:
No parties and or events are permitted. Thank you for your understanding.

The space
This lovely post-Civil War Italianate two story home is located in the hip Lower Garden District. Conventiently situated to all that makes New Orleans beautiful, it is just a block away from the St. Charles Avenue streetcar line, Mardi Gras parade route, and a few blocks from Second Line Studios, Morial Convention Center, The National World War II Museum, the Civil War museum, and the Ogden Museum of Southern Art. The French Quarter is just a ten minute walk away, the funky shops of Magazine Street are nearby, the Julia Street art galleries are a few blocks over, and the bus stop on the corner will get you about anywhere you may want to go. If you enjoy award winning restaurants, coffee shops, great music, and diverse cool people, then this is the place for you. The space
This eclectic studio is in the Marigny neighborhood and is located half a block to the French Quarter. It is walking distance to everything downtown and there are several public transportation stops a block away that will take you Uptown and or City Park. There are many bars and restaurants close by, the French Market, Jackson Square, Frenchman St. and Bourbon St. are all a 5 minute walk away. The Casino, Aquairum, Steamboat and Canal St are about a 10 minute walk.
The studio has a comfortable King size bedroom as well as a queen size foldout couch in the living room if need be. The living room has a small kitchen with fridge, stove/oven, microwave, coffee maker and is stocked with pots, pans, plates and local coffee. description:

VooDoo Fest! Halloween! Saints Games! Sugar Bowl! Mardi Gras!
Great location for everything New Orleans, experience it like a native New Orleanian.

Welcome to our home in the Bywater neighborhood of New Orleans. Our 150 year old home is one block from the river and only a mile from the center of the French Quarter and half a mile from Frenchman Street the center for New Orleans music.

We love new Orleans and the Bywater and are happy to give suggestions about everything there is to enjoy in our great city.


Bywater is a diverse and exuberant neighborhood with an atmosphere unlike anywhere else in New Orleans. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, clubs and the Country Club with a heated pool and a Drag brunch that is sold out weeks in advance are all within easy walking distance.

name: The Harlequin House

name: ~Mid City Oasis~

Lower unit of Southern Duplex located in Mid-City aka "the heart of New Orleans". This unit has 3 bedrooms/1 bath. Fully equipped kitchen. It's just a short 10 minute drive to the French Quarter. Relax & unwind in the beautiful backyard oasis that includes a pool & hot tub! As we say in NOLA, Laissez les bons temps rouler!

The kitchen is fully equipped with stainless appliances such as a large fridge, microwave, dishwasher, oven & washer/dryer. The living room includes a dining table, sofa (w/ a pull out bed), desk & 42in TV. Wifi is available. All towels & linens are provided. The pool is available from 10am-10pm. The hot tub is available upon request. Owner occupies top unit bottom unit is the rental. The pool is for your private use.

The French Quarter is a 10-minute drive. We are a bed and breakfast licensed with the New Orleans Mayoralty Permit Registration Number 198945.

The space
Our house is a classic New Orleans "double" with your vacation home on one side, completely private and independent from our home on the other side of the house, with its own entrance and no common rooms. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places and outfitted with 2 private outdoor spaces, a stay in the Swoop-Duggins House penthouse is the iconic New Orleans experience that most visitors only hope to discover.

The space
The Penthouse loft on the top floor of the Swoop-Duggins House is truly a unique space. It's the only residence in the building (which we own), and my wife and I have spent the better part of 10 years restoring this beautiful piece of New Orleans architectural history. The loft is decorated with modern art from all over the world, including paintings, prints, photography, and sculpture. Natural light absolutely floods this place during the day!

name: Frenchmen House "Green Room"
description:
Victorian-style 100+ year old house on Frenchmen Street -- home of the best collection of jazz clubs in New Orleans -- and still only blocks from the French Quarter.

The space
GREEN ROOM

Frenchmen House is my home. I share it with my puppy Charles (a huge, cuddly golden retriever), Molly (king of the feline world), and my airbnb guests. I have three guest rooms.

The house retains the architectural details that make New Orleans homes interesting and beautiful -- 13 ft. ceilings, transom windows, original wood floors, and double parlor with functioning pocket doors. Very few renovations have altered this original home, and its charm represents the homes of its era. The house is a side-hall shotgun, so unlike a traditional shotgun, one does not have to walk thru each room to get to the next.

Great backyard for entertaining -- very private courtyard setting. Smoking is allowed in the backyard.

Just a 5-minute ferry ride (or 15-minute drive) across from the French Quarter, you'll enjoy an old New Orleans neighborhood in a 1899 home with original details and modern amenities.

We sometimes offer deep discounts on weekdays for our business travelers. We aim to price lower than CBD hotels, so even with a taxi or rideshare you can save more for your bottom line!

The space
One year after the French Quarter was established, Algiers Point was founded, making it the second-oldest neighborhood in the city. Maison Touriste is located in this historic area, which serves as a cherished reminder of authentic New Orleans.

+SUPER CLEAN...

On Canal streetcar line, this large space can sleep up to seven guests without anyone needing to sleep in a sleeping bag. One private bath with standing shower. The neighborhood is full of musicians, the house is on Endymion parade route, near Zulu route, near Jazz Fest and Voodoo Fest, and provides easy access to French Quarter or Garden District.

The space
It's a very large space - about 1000 square feet and can sleep many people. It does not have a separate, external entrance, but you will be given a guest code for keyless entry and alarm setting. description:
Our home is professionally cleaned and sanitized using properly rated disinfectant for COVID-19, as outlined by the WHO.

With 5,000+ sq ft of living space and 1/3 acre of gardens, The Mazant is a historic mansion located in New Orleans' Bywater arts district - about 1.5 miles from the French Quarter (30 minutes walking / 8 minutes by Uber).

The space
Over the past several years we have renovated the property, seeking to preserve historic details including 13' ceilings with plaster medallions, heart pine wood floors, cypress doors, and a 175+ year old oak tree. * Oversized living room with 75-inch television, and Baldwin upright piano

name: Walk / Bike to French Quarter 1
description:
Complimentary Bikes!!! Originally Built in 1872, It comfortably fits 2 and is centrally located on Esplanade Ave! Relax on our balcony overlooking the courtyard, take a dip in the pool, or take a casual stroll to the French Quarter or City Park.
We provide bikes and helmets, and a pool, and guests must use them at their own risk.
We live in the main house on the property and are just a call away.

The space
While you're in New Orleans you should enjoy true Southern hospitality, charm, and history. The two bedroom upstairs apartment is one block from the French Quarter and in the heart of the historic Treme district. The apartment is within easy walking distance of the French Quarter, Bourbon St, Frenchmen St, the Marigny, Canal St, and the CBD. The Esplanade bus is a couple of blocks away and can you to City Park and the Canal and St. Charles streetcars easy to walk to on Canal St. You are right in the middle of New Orleans' finest restaurants, nightclubs and jazz venues. description:
The space
Welcome!

This amazingly centrally located, 2-bedroom, 1-bath apartment with *3* queen-sized beds, truly puts you in the middle of it all! Literally *steps* from trendy Melrose Avenue and just a few blocks from Sunset Blvd, you'll be able to walk to all sorts of day- and nightlife, and yet still have the luxury and convenience of having your own space. Vaccinated Guests, Please.

FYI: We follow all cleaning tips and hygiene recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Our cleaning staff does the following:

Disinfect surfaces between stays with extra attention to areas touched regularly, such as doorknobs, drawer pulls, toilet flush lever, faucet handles, remote controls, and light switches.
Wash towels and linens in hot water between stays. Longer-stay guests can wash linens and towels more often if necessary.
Stock space with tissues, disposable paper towels, hand soap, and hand sanitizer.

This is a charming urban bungalow located right in the heart of bustling Silver Lake and a stone's throw from Los Feliz. It is walking distance from the heart of Silver Lake, Sunset junction, Intelligensia Coffee, Cafe Stella, as well as numerous other great restaurants and cafe's, The Silver lake cheese shop, a 24 hour Von's grocery store, a number of well known bars and music venues, the Vista theatre as well as the many shops and restaurants of Los Feliz. There is a Farmer's market on Saturday and Tuesday in Silver Lake and a Sunday market in Loz Feliz both of which are accessible by foot or an easy drive. Griffith park, The Observatory, The Greek Theatre are just a few of the nearby Los Feliz attractions that can be reached by car in minutes, as well as Elysian Park and the neighborhood of Echo park. Well equipped kitchen for dining in. Chin up and dipping bars and hill are fitness options.

You'll be 10 min from downtown and Silverlake and Dodger stadium. But, why go there when you can enjoy hipster Highland Park and barrio cool Eagle Rock. Norton Simon Museum, Gamble House, Rose Bowl, Occidental
